Key Arguments: The proposed legislation infringes on the fundamental right to freedom of opinion and expression.
Silencing people can lead to anarchy and is contrary to democratic principles.
The bill violates Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
Government should not dictate what people can say or think.
There is a risk of abuse of power by unelected bureaucrats.
Notable Quotes: You have NO right to silence us for having an opinion.
The proposed bill will interfere with people's ability to receive and impart information through social media.
